facts.fact_text: France's official reserve assets increased to €409.26 billion in January 2026, reaching a fresh record high, from €362.74 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: France’s official reserve assets increased to €409.26 billion in January 2026, reaching a fresh record high, from €362.74 billion in December.

facts.fact_text: The rise of €46.52 billion was driven by increases in gold reserves (€334.05 billion vs €287.48 billion in December) and foreign currency reserves (€30.55 billion vs €30.36 billion).

evidences.evidence_text: This represents a rise of €46.52 billion, driven by increases in gold reserves (€334.05 billion vs €287.48 billion in December) and foreign currency reserves (€30.55 billion vs €30.36 billion).

facts.fact_text: Declines were seen in claims on the IMF (€38.20 billion vs €38.41 billion) and other reserve assets (€6.46 billion vs €6.49 billion).

evidences.evidence_text: On the other hand, declines were seen in claims on the IMF (€38.20 billion vs €38.41 billion) and other reserve assets (€6.46 billion vs €6.49 billion).

facts.fact_text: In January 2025, the reserves stood at €292.59 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: In January 2025, the reserves stood at €292.59 billion.

evidence.evidence_text: France Forex Reserves Hit New All-Time High
